name: 1h-carbazole, 2,3,4,9-tetrahydro-
Reason: 1H-carbazole has a melting point of around 100°C due to its rigid structure and the presence of aromaticity, which enhances intermolecular interactions. The basic unit for comparison is benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5°C. The additional functional groups in 1H-carbazole contribute to the melting point: two fused aromatic rings (estimated +25°C each), one nitro group (estimated +50°C), and one methoxy group (estimated +20°C). The carbazole ring itself can also contribute to the melting point due to its rigidity and potential hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +10°C.
